<<<api>>>: Random.nextInt
<<<code>>>: int[][] array = new int[rows][cols];
Random random = new Random();

for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) {
  for (int j = 0; j < cols; j++) {
    int num;
    boolean duplicate;
    do {
      num = random.nextInt(max - min + 1) + min;
      duplicate = false;
      for (int k = 0; k < i; k++) {
        for (int l = 0; l < j; l++) {
          if (array[k][l] == num) {
            duplicate = true;
            break;
          }
        }
        if (duplicate) {
          break;
        }
      }
    } while (duplicate);
    array[i][j] = num;
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses nested loops to iterate over each element of the 2D array. It generates a random number within the desired range using Random.nextInt. It then checks if the generated number is a duplicate by iterating over the previously filled elements of the array. If a duplicate is found, it generates a new random number and repeats the process until a non-duplicate number is found. Finally, it assigns the non-duplicate number to the current element of the array.
